articles.title: KERRY ON THE MISSING LINK SHOW: EVERYTHING ALL AT ONCE
articles.author: Kerry Cassidy
articles.summary: I lay it all on the line. What's Happening, where we are headed and why we need AI, the coming war of worlds, the battle of AI and WHO WE REALLY ARE.    i.e. what's happening, where are we headed, why we are going and who we are.

articles.title: AI: Icarus Redux?
articles.author: schoberwoodworks
articles.summary: There is a lot of buzz about AI and the development of cognitive AI, but it's not clear if it's a good thing or a bad thing. E.O. Wilson points out that humans are motivated by the thrill of the chase and the lure of the challenge to build the Next Big Thing despite the consequences.

articles.title: Meta Deletes AI-Powered Profiles After Users Rediscover Them
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Meta has deleted all 28 AI chatbot profiles from Facebook and Instagram after they sparked controversy online. The rise of user-generated AI chatbots raises questions about the responsibility of their creators and their role in social media content moderation. The company allowed users to create their own chatbots using its platform.

articles.title: Why Super Micro Computer Stock Surged Today
articles.author: Keith Noonan
articles.summary: Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) stock posted big gains in Friday's trading. The server specialist's share price closed out the day's trading up 10.9% amid gains of 1.2% for the S&P 500 index and 1.7% for Nasdaq Composite index. Microsoft Vice Chair and President Brad Smith announced today that the company plans to spend approximately $80 billion on AI infrastructure this year. The company is expected to have capital expenditures of at least $53 billion for 2024.

articles.title: Why Super Micro Computer Stock Surged Today
articles.author: Keith Noonan
articles.summary: Super Micro Computer (NASDAQ: SMCI) stock posted big gains in Friday's trading. The server specialist's share price closed out the day's trading up 10.9% amid gains of 1.2% for the S&P 500 index and 1.7% for Nasdaq Composite index. Microsoft plans to spend approximately $80 billion on AI infrastructure this year. Microsoft is Nvidia's largest customer. Supermicro is the AI leader's third-largest buyer.

articles.title: Meta's 'AI Users' Lead to Backlash, Confusion, and Ultimately Retraction
articles.author: Matt Jancer
articles.summary: Meta created fake 'AI users' on Facebook and Instagram as part of an experiment with artificial intelligence. The experiment was supposed to last until 2023, but it turned out to be a problem with a bug that prevented people from blocking the 'AI user' content. Many of the accounts have been deleted.

articles.title: Why Palantir Stock (PLTR) May Be Worth Considering for 2025
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Palantir has seen its stock price rise by around 360% over the last 12 months. Palantir's products are built around AI-driven data analysis. The company's commercial business has seen revenue accelerate by 54% year-over-year and 13% quarter- over-quarter in Q3. Its PEG ratio of 7.2x is higher than Nvidia's (NVDA).

articles.title: 'Genuinely Weird' and 'WTF': Critics Denounce Meta's AI-Generated Profiles
articles.author: Eloise Goldsmith
articles.summary: On the heels of Meta's short-lived foray into celebrity lookalike AI chatbots, users have been unearthing AI-generated profiles created by Meta that are non-celebrity bots. The reaction to them has been negative. A recent Financial Times article about Meta's push into a range of AI products created by AI created some confusion.

articles.title: Maine law enforcement turns to AI for police reports in the new year
articles.author: Caroline Le Cour
articles.summary: Cumberland County Sheriff's Office and Portland Police Department in Maine are using AI-powered software called "Draft One" to reduce the time spent on paperwork. The ACLU has raised concerns about AI-assisted police reports, but Maine has been using AI in smaller applications for years.

articles.title: AI technology credited for early detection of Orange County vegetation fire
articles.author: Alexi Chidbachian
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence helped identify a wildfire in Orange County in December. It's the first time AI was exclusively responsible for detecting a fire. The technology reported the flames before any humans called in reports of flames or smoke. The fire broke out in Black Star Canyon and was contained to less than a quarter acre.

articles.title: Broomfield student explores the benefits, detriments of AI on society at Hiroshima summit
articles.author: Daily Camera
articles.summary: Caleb Casey is a senior studying online at Arizona State University. He was part of a program that included 30 people from across the U.S. Caleb is studying facets of artificial intelligence that can carry profound implications for our future. He is from Broomfield, Arizona.

articles.title: Microsoft plans to invest $80 billion on AI-enabled data centers in fiscal 2025
articles.author: system
articles.summary: Microsoft plans to invest $80 billion in data centers to train artificial intelligence models and deploy AI and cloud-based applications in fiscal 2025. U.S. leads the global AI race thanks to private capital and innovations by American companies of all sizes, from start-ups to well-established enterprises.

articles.title: Microsoft Expects to Spend $80B on AI This Year
articles.summary: Microsoft president Brad Smith says the company is investing $80 billion into artificial intelligence this fiscal year. He calls on President-elect Donald Trump and Congress to expand support for AI innovation. China and the United States are racing to spread their AI systems to other countries in an effort to become the de facto standard.

articles.title: ✨ The Age of AI: Will 2025 be our last normal year?
articles.author: James Pethokoukis
articles.summary: It's hard to predict the future of AI, but it's not certain human-level AI is coming soon or ever. The Metaculus forecasting platform gave a consensus date for'strong AGI' of Dec. 14, 2032. Now it's Aug. 17, 2031, and the date for weak AGI is Feb. 2, 2027. OpenAI's o3 AI model with enhanced reasoning capabilities for math, science, and programming is a step closer to AGI.

articles.title: Microsoft expects to spend $80 bn on AI this fiscal year
articles.author: AFP
articles.summary: Microsoft is investing $80 billion into artificial intelligence this fiscal year. Brad Smith believes AI is poised to transform all aspects of life and it is imperative that the U.S. be the global leader when it comes to the technology.

articles.title: AI: Why investors need to expand beyond Nvidia
articles.author: Josh Lipton
articles.summary: The artificial intelligence (AI) trade is expanding beyond semiconductors and into infrastructure, data centers, software, inference capabilities, and more. Global X assistant vice president and research analyst Tejas Dessai joins Market Domination to discuss the evolving AI landscape. He believes current infrastructure investments will shift toward AI inference by 2030.

articles.title: Wall Street Shares 4 AI Predictions and Top Stock Picks for 2025
articles.author: Niloy Chakrabarti
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) integration is already paying off for businesses worldwide. Last year's bullish US stock market rally was led by the "magnificent seven" stocks. Wall Street is analysing its impact on economies, labour, and company balance sheets. Top tech firms allocated £179.03 billion towards AI projects in 2024. Goldman Sachs believes the AI revolution has entered Phase 3 of application and technology deployments.

articles.title: Microsoft plans to spend $80 billion on AI data centers by July
articles.summary: The tech giant is on track to invest $80 billion in artificial intelligence. The U.S. is the leader in 'the global AI race' due to private capital investments and innovation. Under the incoming Trump administration, Microsoft can 'build on the foundational ideas set for AI policy'

articles.title: Why AI Chip Stocks Nvidia, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, and Arm Holdings Rallied Today
articles.author: Billy Duberstein
articles.summary: Shares of artificial intelligence (AI) semiconductor stocks Nvidia, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing and Arm Holdings rallied on Friday, up 4.5%, 3.5% and 10.1%. Microsoft Vice President Brad Smith wrote a blog post this morning about the prospects and importance of AI. Microsoft plans to spend $80 billion on AI data centers in the current fiscal year.

articles.title: Microsoft plans to invest $80 billion on AI-enabled data centers in fiscal 2025
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Microsoft is planning to invest $80 billion in data centers to train artificial intelligence (AI) models and deploy AI and cloud-based applications in fiscal 2025. The company's capital expenditure in the first quarter of fiscal 2025 rose 5.3% to $20 billion. More than half of the investment will be in the United States.

articles.title: Cerence stock soars over 140% on new AI partnership with Nvidia
articles.author: Josh Lipton
articles.summary: Cerence (CRNC) shares skyrocketed 140% in Friday's session after announcing an AI partnership with Nvidia (NVDA). Josh Lipton and Josh Schafer break down these stock movements and the details of Cerence's new partnership with NVIDIA.

articles.title: Founders of Phoenix-based Brainiest harness AI for marketing campaigns
articles.author: Amy Edelen
articles.summary: Alan Steinberg and Mike McGowan met for lunch at a Scottsdale Cheesecake Factory in 2023 and decided to create a platform that leverages AI to build high-quality marketing campaigns for businesses. In July 2024, the Phoenix-based startup Brainiest launched its web-based AI software, which acts as a one-stop-shop for marketing campaigns. The platform has more than 40 customized applets in categories that include brand development, content creation, marketing strategy, audio and visual and promotional tools. Brainiest's applets are pre-loaded with questions similar to what a marketing consultant would ask during a discovery meeting and guides users through the process of creating brand guides,

articles.title: Apple Intelligence Errors With News Alerts Continue To Accumulate: Here's The Latest Update
articles.author: Albert Games
articles.summary: Apple introduced a notification summary feature in iOS 18.1, but it's still in beta and there are some errors associated with it. BBC reports several new examples of these errors today. It's possible Apple will eventually disable AI summaries for news applications by default.

articles.title: Microsoft plans to spend $80 billion on AI data centers by July
articles.author: Britney Nguyen
articles.summary: Microsoft is planning to invest $80 billion in AI-enabled data centers in fiscal year 2025. The data centers will be used for training and deploying AI models and cloud-based applications. More than half of the investment will be focused in the U.S.

articles.title: Broomfield student explores the benefits, detriments of AI on society at Hiroshima summit
articles.author: Corbett Stevenson
articles.summary: Caleb Casey is studying business administration and innovation in society at Arizona State University. He took part in the U.S. Japan Joint Summit on AI and the Future of Work in Society in August. The summit was hosted by Hiroshima University in partnership with ASU, the University of Texas at Austin and Purdue University. It included lectures, workshops, company visits, field trips to local attractions and cultural learning experiences in Hiroshima.

articles.title: Preparing The Future Workplace For Generation Beta: Why We Must Start Now
articles.author: Vibhas Ratanjee
articles.summary: Generation Beta will be born between 2025 and 2039. They are projected to account for 16% of the global population by 2035. Generation Beta will grow up in an environment where digital interactions are the norm. This generation will interact with AI more than any previous cohort. Augmented leadership is essential to cultivate the concept of Augmented Leadership with them today.

articles.title: Revolutionizing education: Central Rivers AEA empowers schools to harness power of AI
articles.author: Globe Gazette
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is an integral part of modern life. Siri, Alexa, and others are tools like Siri and Alexa that help people make decisions using AI technology.    iReport.com: What do you think about artificial intelligence in modern life? Share your thoughts.

articles.title: Python, AI, and robots—oh my!
articles.author: Stack Commerce
articles.summary: The Ultimate AI ChatGPT & Python Programming Bundle offers 14 courses and 86 hours of content for just $29.97. It covers topics like building AI chatbots and robotics and mastering Python from the ground up. The hands-on projects are perfect for keeping your skills sharp.

articles.title: Microsoft to Spend $80 Billion on AI Data Centers This Year
articles.author: Brody Ford
articles.summary: Microsoft Corp. plans to spend $80 billion this fiscal year building out data centers. More than half of this projected spending through June 2025 will be in the US. Cloud infrastructure providers like Microsoft and Amazon.com Inc. have been racing to expand computing capacity. Microsoft spent more than $50 billion on capital expenditures in the previous fiscal year.

articles.title: Cancun Hacks Pioneers Travel Plans with AI-Powered Platform Featuring Travel Tips and Insider Hacks
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: Cancun Hacks uses advanced AI bots to create an unforgettable Cancun trip itinerary. Every recommendation provided is backed by data and carefully vetted to ensure accuracy. By leveraging AI, the platform eliminates bias and delivers insights you can trust.

articles.title: Microsoft to spend $80 billion in FY'25 on data centers for AI
articles.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
articles.summary: Microsoft has earmarked $80 billion in fiscal 2025 to build data centers designed to handle artificial intelligence workloads. More than half of that money will be spent in the United States. Microsoft and OpenAI were reportedly in talks in April regarding the construction of a data center facility that would contain an AI supercomputer dubbed Stargate.

articles.title: How to map OpenAI's ChatGPT Advanced Voice Mode to your iPhone action button
articles.summary: ChatGPT's Advanced Voice Mode can be mapped to the Action Button on the left edge of newer iPhone models running iOS 18 or later. The Action Button is a new physical button located just above the volume up and down buttons on newer versions of the iPhone. You need a newer iPhone, from 15 Pro and up to 16 Pro Max.

articles.title: Bill Gates, Amazon's CTO, and other tech leaders share their predictions for 2025
articles.summary: AI's significant impact on workforce and tech use will continue in 2025, leaders say. Shifts in workforce dynamics and consumer tech habits are reportedly on the horizon. Tariffs under Trump may lead to higher prices and project cuts for businesses, Rimini CFO says. The first public protest related to AI is coming in 2025.

articles.title: AI Outperforms Doctors at Ovarian Cancer Diagnosis
articles.author: Dennis Thompson
articles.summary: AI can outperform human doctors when it comes to identifying ovarian cancer from ultrasound images. The AI program achieved an accuracy rate of more than 86%, compared to just under 83% for human experts and nearly 78% for non-expert examiners. In a simulated care scenario, AI cut the number of referrals by 63%, and the misdiagnosis rate by 18%.

articles.title: Meta scrambles to delete its own AI accounts after backlash intensifies
articles.author: Allison Morrow
articles.summary: Meta deleted several of its AI-generated chatbots after human users complained about their sloppy imagery and tendency to lie in chats with humans. Last week, Connor Hayes, a vice president for Meta's generative AI, told the Financial Times that the company expects its homemade AI users to appear on its platforms in the same way as human accounts. Some of the AI accounts disingenuously described themselves as actual people with racial and sexual identities. On Friday, the company took down the accounts, citing a bug.

articles.title: Meta scrambles to delete its own AI accounts after backlash intensifies
articles.author: Allison Morrow
articles.summary: Meta deleted several AI-generated accounts after human users began engaging with them and posting about the bots' sloppy imagery and tendency to lie in chats with humans. Last week, Connor Hayes, a vice president for Meta's generative AI, told the Financial Times that the company expects its homemade AI users to appear on its platforms in the same way as human accounts. The backlash grew because of the way the AI accounts disingenuously described their racial and sexual identities. On Friday, Meta took down the accounts, many of which dated back at least a year, citing a bug.

articles.title: Microsoft expects to spend $80 billion on AI-enabled data centers in fiscal 2025
articles.author: Jordan Novet Cnbc
articles.summary: Microsoft expects to spend $80 billion in fiscal 2025 on the construction of data centers that can handle artificial intelligence workloads. Over half of Microsoft's spending will take place in the U.S. Microsoft's 2025 fiscal year ends in June. The United States leads the global AI race.

articles.title: Microsoft expects to spend $80 billion on AI-enabled data centers in fiscal 2025
articles.author: Jordan Novet Cnbc
articles.summary: Microsoft plans to spend $80 billion in fiscal 2025 on the construction of data centers that can handle artificial intelligence workloads. Over half of the expected AI infrastructure spending will take place in the U.S. Microsoft reported $20 billion in capital expenditures and assets acquired under finance leases in the first quarter of fiscal 2025.

articles.title: Dr. Chatbot is not ready to see you: Critical flaws in medical AI systems exposed by Harvard-Stanford study
articles.author: Studyfinds Staff
articles.summary: When AI doctors had to diagnose through conversation rather than multiple choice tests, accuracy dropped from 82% to as low as 26% in some cases. Current AI systems struggle with basic clinical skills like asking appropriate follow-up questions and synthesizing information from multiple exchanges. Current evaluation methods rely on multiple-choice medical exam questions.

articles.title: How will tomorrow's employees master the AI revolution in 2025?
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence continues its rapid evolution, many workers are wondering how it will impact their careers in the next few years. Some experts are focusing on how tomorrow's employees can master the AI revolution. Others argue that workers should embrace it as a tool to enhance their skills and productivity.

articles.title: San Jose State Students Tackle Academic Shortcomings With AI
articles.author: San Jose Spotlight
articles.summary: Gabriel Castaneda, Nicolaus Hilleary, Kai Zhao, Glerys Gonzalez and others created CollegeBot.AI to help students navigate through their class requirements and address long wait times for face-to-face appointments with university advisors. They received more than $500,000 in funding from venture capitalists and angel investors.

articles.title: Answering your questions about AI, smart glasses, TikTok, and more
articles.author: Alex Heath
articles.summary: This week's mailbag is a special mailbag issue with questions from last year's readers. This year's questions cover some of the themes I plan to continue covering in 2025. Sam Altman and others believe that some form of universal basic income will be necessary to offset the economic impacts of AGI, but it's too early to be seriously concerned.

articles.title: AI PCs will change the future of hybrid work, says senior HP executive Vineet Gehani
articles.author: TOI Tech Desk
articles.summary: The year 2024 marks a significant turning point in the evolution of the workplace. AI-powered PCs are leading the way in transforming hybrid work environments. HP is committed to leading this transformation. In the next few years, AI PCs will make up 50% of HP's portfolio.

articles.title: Southern Taiwan to be transformed into ‘AI hub'
articles.author: Taipei Times
articles.summary: The government is aiming to turn the southern region of Taiwan into a hub for artificial intelligence development and expand its applications in various sectors, President William Lai said in Tainan. The program is called "Southern Taiwan Silicon Valley Program" and is based on CNA's report.

articles.title: Adobe Stock Falls as UBS Lowers Price Target in ‘Fiercely Competitive' AI Market
articles.author: Mackenzie Tatananni
articles.summary: Adobe could lose ground as rivals like OpenAI establish themselves in the market for creative artificial intelligence, UBS analysts said on Friday. They lowered their target for the stock price to $475 from $525 while maintaining a Neutral rating on the shares. Adobe has increasingly embraced AI, rolling out its Firefly suite and incorporating generative AI tools into its flagship photo-editing software.

articles.title: THE MYSTERIOUS MURDER OF SUCHIR BALAJI AND OPEN AI
articles.author: Kerry Cassidy
articles.summary: Whistleblower Suchir Balaji was murdered by the Secret Space Program. Suchir reported on rampant violations by OpenAI of copyrighted and patented intellectual property. There is evidence that there is a move to delete human history from Open AI. There are questions about the future of AI and the relationship between humans and aliens.

articles.title: AI Proves Useful for Ovarian Cancer Diagnosis
articles.summary: AI can outperform human doctors in identifying ovarian cancer from ultrasound images. Clinical trials are needed to test its usefulness, but AI did a better job than doctors in reviewing ultrasounds, in terms of accuracy, according to the study.    iReport.com

articles.title: Cerence (CRNC), Oklo (OKLO) Are Among Today's Big Winners
articles.author: Larry Ramer
articles.summary: Cerence (CRNC) is soaring over 100%, while Oklo (OKLO) is advancing 18%. Cerence "provides AI powered virtual assistants for the mobility/transportation market" and Oklo is looking to build small modular nuclear reactors. Cerence agreed to widen its existing deal with Nvidia. Oklo rose on the new rules regarding eligibility for tax credits for producing clean hydrogen.

articles.title: Why SoFi Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:SOFI) Crashed Yesterday
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: The stock market finished the first trading day of the year in the negative territory. SoFi Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:SOFI) dropped for a fourth day on Thursday, losing 8.25 percent or 1.27 points to end at $14.13 each. Keefe, Bruyette & Woods's Timothy Switzer downgraded the stock to 'underperform' and cut the price target to $7 from $8.

articles.title: Why Bilibili Inc. (NASDAQ:BILI) Crashed Yesterday
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros
articles.summary: The stock market finished the first trading day of the year in the negative territory. Bilibili Inc. (NASDAQ:BILI) saw its share price decline by 5.41 percent or 0.98 points to end at $17.13 following disappointing earnings results.

articles.title: At the Intersection of A.I. and Spirituality
articles.summary: Rabbi Josh Fixler used an A.I. chatbot to write a sermon at Congregation Emanu El in Houston. Pastor Jay Cooper used ChatGPT to generate an entire service for his church as an experiment in 2023. Pastor Phil EuBank, a pastor at Menlo Park, California, compared A.i. to a 'bionic arm' that could supercharge his work.

articles.title: Meta's AI-generated bot profiles are not being received well
articles.author: Mia Sato
articles.summary: In September 2023, Meta made a big deal of its new AI chatbots that used celebrities' likeness. The celebrity-based bots were killed off last summer after less than a year. Recently, users have been finding a handful of fake bot profiles still floating around. The reaction is confusion, frustration and anger.

articles.title: Embracing AI in schools: Teaching responsibility in a digital world
articles.summary: Durango School District 9-R has released its new AI policy on Dec. 13. The policy is aimed at preparing students for an AI-driven world while staying true to the values of the Portrait of a Graduate: critical thinking, ethical behavior, collaboration and adaptability. St. Vrain Valley School District launched 'Exploration AI,' a program training teachers to integrate tools like chatbots into lessons.

articles.title: Dangers of AI in criminal law
articles.author: JASON SWINDLE
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is influencing various aspects of criminal justice, from law enforcement and forensic investigations to judicial decision-making. Criminal law is no exception. It represents a rapidly evolving and potentially dangerous path of legal and ethical discourse. It is influencing law enforcement, forensic investigations and judicial decisions.

articles.title: Thread by @mindpal_ai on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: MindPal explains what an AI agent is. AI agents are a specialized digital assistant powered by LLM. They can be trained on your data, connected to various tools and do multi-step reasoning. You don't need coding skills to make them. MindPal lets you create and deploy AI agents in minutes.

articles.title: Will AI take away jobs from Baton Rouge professionals?
articles.author: Cynthea Corfah
articles.summary: Baton Rouge and New Orleans are among the large metropolitan areas with low employment exposure to large language models, or LLMs. Baton Rouge has high education levels, affordable housing costs, and its leading industries are less likely to be replaced by LLMs, according to the study.

articles.title: Elon Musk's Grok can now analyze images and it does a pretty good job, until you reach your usage limit
articles.author: Graham Barlow
articles.summary: Grok, the AI chatbot that's built into X.com, has added the ability to analyze images. It does a good job until you reach the usage limit on a free account, which is set to three uploads. The biggest issue with Grok is that you very quickly hit the free usage limit for uploading images.

articles.title: Council Post: AI In B2B Marketing: From Hype To Essential Growth Driver
articles.author: Peter Benei
articles.summary: Peter Benei, Principal Consultant at Intercept Scale explains how to integrate AI into marketing workflows effectively. He recommends creating an AI vision, a road map and a policy to protect data and build trust in AI-driven decision-driven decisions.

articles.title: Here's How Nvidia's Vice-Like Grip on AI Chips Could Slip
articles.author: Edd Gent
articles.summary: Nvidia has dominated the market for AI-specific chips since 2012. AMD and Intel are trying to catch up with Nvidia in the race for AI chips. Amazon, Google, Microsoft, and Amazon are also developing their own custom AI chips to compete with Nvidia's products.

articles.title: Rethinking AI And Robotics: Emphasizing Efficiency Over Functionality
articles.author: Tim Bajarin
articles.summary: Washington Post article suggests that robots need to become lazier to save energy. Data centers generate around 1% of energy-related greenhouse gas emissions, but by 2026, data centers are projected to use double the electricity than they did in 2022. AI, especially large language models, and neural networks, require immense computational power, translating into a tremendous demand for energy. Technology companies like Nvidia and AMD are pushing the boundaries of semiconductor design, creating specialized chips that can perform AI computations more efficiently. Optimizing AI algorithms to be more energy-efficient is an area of growing focus. Smaller, more efficient models like those seen in edge AI are also becoming key players.

articles.title: AI SAY New AI cameras which can tell if a driver is DRUNK are rolled out on UK roads...
articles.author: Robert Lee
articles.summary: The new AI cameras that can catch drunk drivers in the act have been rolled out in Devon and Cornwall. The state-of-the-art tech, developed by Acusensus, works by scanning passing cars for tell tale signs of impaired driving. The cameras spot it all and instantly alert nearby police, who swoop in for a closer look.

articles.title: Is a hybrid AI-human model the key to superior customer service?
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: A common misconception is that AI will replace human agents in call centers. AI excels at performing repetitive tasks quickly and accurately, but it lacks the emotions, empathy and nuanced decision-making that human agents provide. AI is not a replacement for human agents, however.

articles.title: BCMI Expands ProPilot AI Capabilities to Empower Concrete Producers With New Agent
articles.author: BCMI
articles.summary: BCMI has expanded its suite of artificial intelligence (AI) tools with a time-saving AI agent. This tool monitors business-critical records and calculates the information you need in an instant. BCMI is investing heavily in AI through its ProPilot suite of products.

articles.title: Marketing and communications outlook for 2025
articles.author: Andrea Aker
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence will play an increasingly critical role in business operations in marketing and sales. Andrea Aker is CEO of Aker Ink PR & Marketing, a full-service agency in Scottsdale that helps growth-oriented businesses to achieve more awareness, thought leadership, leads and revenue.

articles.title: McAfee Brings McAfee Deepfake Detector to Select HP Copilot+ PCs
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: McAfee's automatic, AI-powered deepfake detection technology gives consumers an essential tool for assessing the authenticity of online videos with audio. It is available for English language detection on the OmniBook Ultra Flip and HP OmniBook X Next-Gen AI PCs, in the US, UK, Australia, India, and Ireland. It's also available on select HP Copilot+ PCs.

articles.title: Is a hybrid AI-human model the key to superior customer service?
articles.author: Eric Ezenwa
articles.summary: There is a misconception that AI will replace human agents in call centers. Instead, it's more effective to see AI as an enabler for human roles, enhancing customer service. AI-driven tools can handle tasks like data entry and account creation, but customers still prefer one-on-one interactions with humans.

articles.title: CM Maryam welcomes $ 700m Chinese investment in Punjab
articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: A high-level Chinese delegation met Punjab Chief Minister Maryam Nawaz Sharif's at Punjab House, Islamabad on Friday. Chengdu General Coordinator for wants Punjab to become an IT hub in the region and wants its youth to excel and surpass in the IT sector.

articles.title: The Last Moments Of The AI Whistleblower
articles.author: Vic Hughes
articles.summary: Suchir Balaji, 26, was shot dead in his San Francisco apartment on November 22nd. Suchir was the star witness in possibly as many as four high-profile lawsuits over the future of artificial intelligence. Balaji was about to take advantage of his world-class knowledge of AI to create a new Silicon Valley startup. His last meal was still on the table at 6:13 pm on the night of November 22. The backup storage device may have been prepared as evidence for the New York Times lawsuit against Open AI.

articles.title: 16 fascinating breakthroughs of 2024 that weren't about AI
articles.author: Fast Company
articles.summary: There is a lot of excitement around artificial intelligence, but there is also progress that's been the result of human intelligence. It's getting harder to say what's not got some bit of AI or deep learning or neural networks in it, but it's getting easier to find discoveries that enable machine learning.

articles.title: McAfee Brings McAfee Deepfake Detector to Select HP Copilot+ PCs
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: McAfee Deepfake Detector is preinstalled on the HP OmniBook Ultra Flip and the OmniBook X Next-Gen AI PCs. McAfee's Smart AI Hub remains a trusted resource offering up-to-date information and educational content on AI, cybersecurity, deepfakes and AI-powered scams.

articles.title: Opinion
articles.summary: Focus on the four emerging themes: autonomous AI, boost developer productivity, empower with total experience, deliver human-centric security and privacy, and deliver total experience for developers.    For more information on how to think about AI, go to: http://www.justgiving.com/how-to-think-about-ai.

articles.title: AKOOL Introduces AMD-Advanced Technology, Revolutionizing Digital Experiences with Simplified In-Device Avatars
articles.author: Akool
articles.summary: AKOOL and AMD have forged a strategic partnership to revolutionize digital experiences through Simplified In-Device Avatar technology. It combines AKOOL's innovative AI capabilities with AMD's advanced processing technologies like AMD Ryzen and AMD EPYC processors to deliver secure, efficient and high-performance digital assistants across various industries.

articles.title: Avathon to Empower Nonprofits with Industrial AI Technology
articles.author: Avathon
articles.summary: Tessy Antony de Nassau has been appointed to Avathon's advisory board to help launch Avathon for Good. Avathon will bring its AI platform to nonprofit agencies around the world to create safer, more connected schools, hospitals, and cities.

articles.title: RoboSense Unveils AI Robotics Strategy and Cutting-Edge Innovations at 2025 Global Launch Event
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: RoboSense hosted the world's first AI Robotics Global Online Launch Event of 2025, "Hello Robot" in Las Vegas. The event marked a pivotal moment in the global leader in robotics technology platforms, RoboSense, a pioneering AI-driven robotics technology company.

articles.title: AI: A dangerous necessity for national security
articles.author: Tags
articles.summary: The Department of Defense is investing heavily in artificial intelligence (AI) technology. The Department of Justice is taking actions that threaten to stifle its development. China's pursuit of AI dominance by 2030 poses a significant threat to U.S. leadership in AI. The DOJ has targeted companies like RealPage, accusing their AI-driven pricing algorithms of antitrust violations. Conservatives must advocate for policies that balance risks and rewards of AI.

articles.title: Will AI revolutionize drug development? Researchers explain why it depends on how it's used
articles.author: Duxin Sun
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being used to design drugs and optimize clinical trials. It is not yet clear if it can address the 90% failure rate of new drugs in clinical trials, but it can help address the root causes of drug failure and streamline the process. He met his wife Donna Candelaria in 1996 at the Crazy Horse Saloon in Orange County, California. articles.title: Intel spinoff Articul8 eyes $250M ARR in 4 years: CEO
articles.author: Business Line
articles.summary: Articul8 expects to reach the $250 million ARR mark in four years. In January 2024, Intel and DigitalBridge Group will form a new GenAI company called Articul 8, which will be Intel's spin-off company.

articles.title: SenseTime scales back Singapore office amid post-ChatGPT challenges
articles.author: Cryptopolitan
articles.summary: SenseTime Group Inc. is downsizing its office space in Singapore and moving out of a large downtown location into a smaller and cheaper office. The move is a major scaleback of its once ambitious expansion plans as the company confronts rising competition in the market.

articles.title: No AGI But A ‘Killer App' - 2025 AI Prediction (1/10)
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: There will be no artificial general intelligence in 2025. Large Language Models (LLMs) excel. OpenAI's O1 is amazing but not AI, because it has technical shortcomings. O1 can be better than AGI in the future, but not yet.

articles.title: Delicate robot hands know just how hard to squeeze
articles.author: New Scientist
articles.summary: A robotic hand uses fingertip sensors and AI to determine how firmly to grip before closing in on an object, overcoming a persistent problem for prosthetic hands.   Â      in the future, a robotic hand will be able to control objects with its own artificial intelligence.

articles.title: The US Department of Defense Tests AI Chatbots in Military Medical Services
articles.author: Bit RSS
articles.summary: The US Department of Defense recently completed a project exploring how artificial intelligence (AI) chatbots might support medical services in the military. The project was led by the DoD's AI division, which is responsible for the development of chatbots for the medical services.

articles.title: AI stocks will rule the roost in 2025 and this one could be the biggest bargain Buy; here's why
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: of AI stocks are ruling the entirety of Wall Street in the last couple of months and is showing no indication of halting.   for the last few months of months of the last two years of the past two years, and is ruling the whole market.  for now.

articles.title: AI-generated UFO video shows how fast visual truth is slipping away
articles.author: Boing Boing
articles.summary: A fake video of a UFO crash site was created using AI tools including Midjourney. It shows both the current limitations and the alarming potential of artificial intelligence to create such fake videos using AI. It also shows the limitations and potential of AI to create fake videos.
